text: A traditional breakfast dish from Guerrero, made with dried beef that is pounded, shredded, and cooked in a flavorful red or green sauce with scrambled eggs. It’s hearty, savory, and deeply tied to the region’s culinary identity.

A festive and unique dish from Iguala, made with a mix of meats, vegetables, and pickled ingredients, seasoned with regional spices. Traditionally served during celebrations, it showcases the city’s culinary creativity.
Sweet bread rolls flavored with anise and sometimes topped with sugar. A beloved local treat, often enjoyed with coffee or at family gatherings, representing Iguala’s traditional bakery flavors.
